name: Third Voice Exhibition
description:
A collaborative exhibition by three artists focused on exploring art from a materials-first perspective. Materials speak shaping a dialogue that extends beyond the artists where paint, surface and light respond becoming a unique voice in the conversation. From translucent layers to reactive surfaces, gestural marks to shifting reflections, the artists find common ground in the physicality of making. 

Unified by process-driven approaches, the works span painting, mixed media, and reactive surface treatments. The exhibition explores themes of emotional resonance, memory and material transformation. Light, reflection and surface tension play vital roles in shaping the viewer's experience drawing attention to what lies beneath and beyond. Featured artists are Christie Baker, David Adshade and Sue Mackay.

name: Urban Animal Tracking Webinar
description: Curious about what animals roam around Toronto during the winter? Join Kristen Bedley from City of Toronto's Urban Forestry department for an exciting virtual journey through the city teaching you how to read animal tracks and traces in Toronto's winter wonderland. From tiny mouse prints to the larger paws and hoofs of coyotes and deer, you'll learn to recognize their footprints and what they can tell us about their winter survival strategies in the urban environment. Don't miss this opportunity to brighten winter by discovering hidden stories left in the snow!
